page.title: 16Basing House - History
page.content: When the{Civil War}started in 1643 Basing House was in a good strategic place on the road leading to the west, as Basingstoke does today. Basing House was then owned by the {King's loyal friend,John Paulet, {Marquis of Winchester,}but it was in a {parliamentary area}with the nearest {Royal base}at Oxford. The{seige}started in July 1643 and finished in October 1645, 6 days after {Cromwell}arrived at the house. When the{parliament army}searched the house they found John Paulet hiding in an{oven. The Paulets still own the house and the present owner searched the house and grounds thoroughly to find the legendary{golden calf.}He failed and hardly ever visits the house now.
